ol.li: Understand the definition of \R^n, and how to use \R^n to label points.
Learn to replace a system of linear equations by an augmented matrix.
Learn how the elimination method corresponds to performing row operations on an augmented matrix.
Vocabulary words: consistent, inconsistent, solution set, row operation, row equivalence, matrix, augmented matrix.

subsection.title: Preliminaries: Line, Plane, Space, Etc.
subsection.p: 0The number zero We use \R Real numbers \R \RThe real numbers to denote the set of all real numbers, i.e., the number line. This contains numbers like 0, \frac 32, -\pi, 104, \ldots

statement.p: Let n be a positive whole number. We define \R^n = \text{all ordered $n$-tuples of real numbers }(x_1,x_2,x_3,\ldots,x_n).

subsection.p: In other words, \R^n is just the set of all (ordered) lists of n real numbers. We will draw pictures of \R^n in a moment, but keep in mind that this is the definition. For example, (0, \frac 32, -\pi) is an element of \R^3.

specialcase.title: The number line

subsection.p: The number line \R=\R^1 is an example of a line, but a line is not the same as \R^1. We will see later how to use the elements of \R^1 to label the points on a line.

specialcase.title: The plane
specialcase.p: Note that we use the elements of \R^2 to label the points of the plane, but \R^2 is not defined to be the plane.

statement.p: A plane is a flat sheet that is infinite in all directions.

figure.caption: The plane in \R^3 defined by the equation x+y+z=1.

subsection.p: The xy-plane \R^2 is an example of a plane, but a plane is not the same as \R^2. We will see later how to use the elements of \R^2 to label the points on a plane.

specialcase.title: 3-Space

example.title: Color Space
Traffic Flow
QR Codes
example.p: A QR code is a method of storing data in a grid of 29\times 29 black and white squares in a way that computers can easily read. When an imaging device sees a QR code, it constructs an array of 29\times 29 points. Of course, a camera actually sees varying degrees of grey; the brightness of each point is just a real number, so the image can be viewed as an element of \R^{29\cdot 29} = \R^{841}. The QR reader then must find the closest point in \R^{841} with coordinates all equal to zero (black) or one (white); this is the actual QR code.
As in the previous , it is very useful from a psychological perspective to view a QR code as a single piece of data in this way.

figure.caption: The QR code for this textbook is a 29\times29 array of black/white squares.

subsection.p: So what is \R^4? or \R^5? or \R^n? These are harder to visualize, so you have to go back to the definition: \R^n is the set of all ordered n-tuples of real numbers (x_1,x_2,x_3,\ldots,x_n).
They are still geometric spaces, in the sense that our intuition for \R^2 and \R^3 often extends to \R^n.
We will make definitions and state theorems that apply to any \R^n, but we will only draw pictures for \R^2 and \R^3.

subsection.title: Solving Systems of Equations
subsection.p: During the first half of this textbook, we will be primarily concerned with understanding the solutions to linear equations.

statement.p: An equation in the unknowns x,y,z,\ldots is called linear if both sides of the equation are a sum of (constant) multiples of x,y,z,\ldots, plus an optional constant.

subsection.p: We will usually move the unknowns to the left side of the equation, and move the constants to the right.

ul.li: A solution of a system of equations is a list of numbers x, y, z, \ldots that make all of the equations true simultaneously.
The solution set of a system of equations is the collection of all solutions.
Solving the system means describing the solution set parametrically.

subsection.p: A solution of a system of equations in n variables is a list of n numbers: it is an element of \R^n. For example, (x,y,z) = (1,-2,3) is a solution of ; this is an element of \R^3.

paragraphs.title: The elimination method
Augmented Matrices and Row Operations

bluebox.p: The process of doing row operations to a matrix does not change the solution set of the corresponding linear equations!

paragraphs.p: Indeed, the whole point of doing these operations is to solve the equations using the elimination method.

statement.p: Two matrices are called row equivalent if one can be obtained from the other by doing some number of row operations.

paragraphs.p: So the linear equations of row-equivalent matrices have the same solution set.

statement.p: A system of equations is called inconsistent if it has no solutions. It is called consistent otherwise.
